data.title: arnold: Name Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Arnold is a timeless, classic name of strength and legacy. Explore this Germanic name's rich history and enduring appeal, symbolizing ‘eagle power.’
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Arnold

Arnold, a male given name with German roots, signifies ‘eagle power,’ blending elements of ‘eagle’ from Arn and ‘power, authority’ from Walt. This name was introduced to England by the Normans, eventually supplanting its Old English counterpart, Earnweald. Noteworthy figures bearing this name encompass an eighth-century musician at Charlemagne’s court, and an 11th-century French bishop revered as the patron saint of brewers.

Variants of the name Arnold span various cultures and languages. These include Arend (German), Arnoald (Germanic), Arnaud (French), Arnolds (Latvian), Arnaldo, Arnoldo, Naldo (Italian), Nöl, Nölke (Limburgish), Arnau (Catalan), Arnoldas (Lithuanian), Arnoud, Arnout, Arend (Dutch), Arnt (Norwegian), and Arnaldo (Portuguese). Arnie, Arnd, Arne, Arndt, Arn, Arno, and Ari may be a few cute and endearing nicknames for Arnold.

The name Arnold has both given name and surname origins. As a surname, it typically has roots in Old German and Anglo-Saxon. It originates from the baptismal name Ernault or Arnolt, combining the elements arn, signifying an ‘eagle,’ with wald, denoting ‘to rule.’ This last name gained popularity across Northern Europe during the era known as The Dark Ages, spanning from the 6th to 11th centuries AD, following the decline of the Roman Empire (1).

Several fictional characters have been named Arnold across various forms of media. These include Arnold, the loyal pet dog of the Turtle character in the TV series Entourage, and Arnold, a character featured in the 2003 film Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over. Additionally, there’s Arnold Jackson, a memorable character from the NBC sitcom Diff’rent Strokes, and the notable figure Arnold Toht, known for his appearance in the film Raiders of the Lost Ark. In the realm of television drama, we have Arnold Vinick from The West Wing. Fans of classic sitcoms might recognize Arnold Ziffel from Green Acres.

From influential and significant historical figures to modern pop culture characters, Arnold appears as an enduring name that carries depth. With its widespread usage across cultures, the name has a versatile appeal and familiar tone to it.

How To Pronounce Arnold?

‘Arnold’ In QR Code

Notable People Named Arnold

This section covers people who have made the name Arnold famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don’t you think?

Arnold SchwarzeneggerActor, filmmaker, businessman, author, and former politician and professional bodybuilder

Arnold PalmerProfessional golfer and businessman

Arnold SchoenbergComposer, music theorist, teacher, writer, and painter

Arnold RidleyEnglish playwright and actor

Arnold ChernushevichSoviet Belarusian fencer and bronze medalist in the 1960 Summer Olympics

Arnold Samuel ShapiroAmerican mathematician known for his Shapiro's lemma and eversion of the sphere

Arnold Name’s Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby’s name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it’s presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it’s popularity. A name’s online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Arnold fares on that count.

Names Rhyming With Arnold

The significance of rhyming names extends beyond their aesthetic appeal and a good feel. The repetition and symmetry enhance their memorability. If you want your children’s names to be easily remembered or tune with your name, try some rhyming names. Here are such names that rhyme with Arnold.

Anagram Names Of Arnold

William Shakespeare is known for his ‘onomastic wit,’ with anagrams being one of them (remember the play Twelfth Night?). Anagram is the rearrangement of the same letters to form different words. Anagramming names has been in vogue for centuries now, and why not when it can create some cute names? Anagram baby names stand out with their unique sound and spellings. You may try an anagram of your name or your partner’s; even better if you combine both names and then try an anagram for the baby. It all stays in the family this way. You may also try anagram names for siblings, especially twins. Here are some anagrams of Arnold.

Landor Lorand Orland Roland Roldan Ronald

Arnold’s Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person’s exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person’s birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth’s orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun’s position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun’s position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby’s zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby’s date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Arnold’s Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Arnold Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person’s character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person’s attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual’s personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Arnold is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Arnold‘s Personality As Per Numerology
